content: be referred to as twisted rib repeat these 2 row of twisted rib 4 5 5 6 times more change to larger needles the jumper is knitted in stocking stitch right side row knit reverse side purl from this point knit 2 row in main colour border chart 1 work the 2 row of chart 1 joining in colours as required you will have one extra stitch at the end of the first row and the start of the second work this in main colour on both row work 2 row in contrast a to knit the birds border - row 1 1st size k2a work across the 15 stitches of chart 1 k2 in background colour repeat to end 2nd size k3a work across the 15 stitches of chart 1 k3 in background colour repeat to end 3rd size k1a work across the 15 stitches of chart 1 k1 in background colour repeat to end 4th size k1a work across the 15 stitches of chart 1 k2 in background colour repeat to end �3 this places the birds work the remaining 10 row of the chart work two row in contrast a border chart 2 work the 2 row of chart 2 joining in colours as required you will have one extra stitch at the start of the first row and the end of the second one work this stitch in main colour on both row work in stocking stitch and just main colour until back measures - 6 5 8 9 10 inches 16 5 20 23 25 centimetres ending on a purl row with a knit row facing you for the next row you can lengthen or shorten the jumper at this point by knitting more or fewer row remember to do this on the front as well and allow for it when you calculate how much yarn you will need to shape the armhole cast off 2 3 3 4 stitches at the start of the next 2 row 49 51 59 61 row 1 k2 s p2 decrease knit to last 4 sts p2 decrease k2 row 2 purl to end *** repeat these 2 row until 17 19 25 25 stitches remain front complete rib as for back until you reach *** repeat the two decrease row until you have 27 29 35 35 stitches ending with a wrong side row to shape the neck row 1 k1 s1 k1 psso k8 turn leaving remaining stitches on needle row 2 p1 s1 p1 psso p7 row 3 k1 s1 k1 psso k6 row 4 purl to end row 5 k1 s1 k1 psso k5 row 6 p1 s1 p1 psso p4 row 7 k1 s1 k1 psso k3 row 8 purl to end row 9 k1 s1 k1 psso k2 row 10 p1 s1 p1 psso p1 row 11 k3tog fasten_off leave centre 5 7 13 13 stitches on a spare needle stitch holder or length of yarn join wool to remaining 11 stitches
